learning_outcomes.description: Explain the rationale for the formal specification and verification of programs.
Specify the desired behaviour of methods and functions in a program in a mathematically precise way.
Use formal techniques to verify that a method is correct with respect to its specification.
Derive correct methods from abstract specifications using a formal, structured approach.
Specify and verify the correctness of objects and data structures in programs.
Use a verification tool to automatically and interactively verify the correctness of programs.

assessments.task_description:
Students will formally verify one or more programs using weakest precondition reasoning.

Students must clearly reference any use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) in completing this assessment task. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are to be submitted electronically via Gradescope.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will formally specify and derive one or more methods, and verify them using the Dafny verification tool.

Students must clearly reference any use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) in completing this assessment task. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are to be submitted electronically via Gradescope.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will formally specify one or more programs using objects and data structures, and verify them using the Dafny verification tool.

Students must clearly reference any use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) in completing this assessment task. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are to be submitted electronically via Gradescope.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A two-hour final examination will be held during the final examination period. The examination is used to assess both the practical ability of the students on small problems and their understanding of the course material.

The exam is closed book. Calculators and other computing or communication devices are not permitted.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Checkpoint quiz

A checkpoint quiz will provide early progress feedback to students. This will be administered online in week 4, and should be used by students to gauge progress prior to the census date.
